newsitem.title: HUNGARY: AUDI HUNGARY REPORTS 42.3 MLN MARK PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: AUDI HUNGARY REPORTS 42.3 MLN MARK PROFIT.

text.p: BUDAPEST, March 19 (Reuter) German automaker Audi AG said on Wednesday its Hungarian engine plant posted profits of 42.3 million marks on turnover of 521.8 million marks in 1996.
The results showed an improvement on 1995, when Audi Hungaria Motor Kft> (AHM) reported earnings of 29.4 million marks on revenue of 290.9 million marks.
AHM, which is wholly owned by Audi, received a package of investment incentives from the Hungarian goverment including a 10-year exemption from corporate profit taxes.
The higher numbers reflect a rise in engine output to 196,532 units in 1996 from 104,206 units in 1995, AHM said.
AHM also said it invested 149.2 million marks in 1996, bringing its total investment in Hungary to 600 million marks.
Audi is a part of German automotive group Volskwagen AG.
